intro: Haloragis filiformis, commonly known as the slender willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats. The plant features slender, branching stems that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Haloragis filiformis plays an important role in stabilizing soil in aquatic environments.
